daboross.gemagame.code

Class Character

  • java.lang.Object
    • daboross.gemagame.code.Character

  • public class Character
extends java.lang.Object

        How much the speedY increases when the character jumps
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • centerX

        private double centerX
        the center of the character's x position and y position. These define the center, not the upper left hand corner

      • centerY

        private double centerY
        the center of the character's x position and y position. These define the center, not the upper left hand corner

      • speedX

        private double speedX
        The amount of distance that the character travels each update. Each // update these are multiplied by a Decimal

      • speedY

        private double speedY
        The amount of distance that the character travels each update. Each // update these are multiplied by a Decimal

      • velocityX

        private double velocityX
        the amount that speedX will increase by each update

        private double gravity
        the amount that is subtracted from speedY each update

        These are changed to represent the nearest wall or floor or ceiling in each direction

        How close the character gets to the left edge of the screen before he starts scrolling the view.

        private double rightScrollEdgeOffSet
        How close the character gets to the right edge of the screen before he starts scrolling the view.

        These are updated each update to represent the width and height of the screen

        private int screenHeight
        These are updated each update to represent the width and height of the screen

      • shootTimer

        private int shootTimer
        A timer used in counting how long until the character can shoot again

      • shootTimerReset

        private int shootTimerReset
        The amount the shootTimer is reset to when the character shoots

      • shootWhenReady

        private boolean shootWhenReady
        When an arrow key is pressed and the timer isn't reset yet, this variable is set to true.

      • shootWhenReadyX

        private int shootWhenReadyX
        When the character can shoot again, if shootWhenReady, then it will shoot with the speeds shootWhenReadyX and shootWhenReadyY.

      • shootWhenReadyY

        private int shootWhenReadyY
        When the character can shoot again, if shootWhenReady, then it will shoot with the speeds shootWhenReadyX and shootWhenReadyY.

      • projSpeed

        private int projSpeed
        How fast projectiles the character shoots go.

      • rotation

        private double rotation
        This variable is updated when the character moves, and represents how much the character has turned or rotated. Used when the character is drawn

      • isLimitedLeft

        private boolean isLimitedLeft
        These variables are updated to hold whether the Character is limited in moving to the Left, Right, Top or Bottom

      • isLimitedRight

        private boolean isLimitedRight
        These variables are updated to hold whether the Character is limited in moving to the Left, Right, Top or Bottom

      • isLimitedTop

        private boolean isLimitedTop
        These variables are updated to hold whether the Character is limited in moving to the Left, Right, Top or Bottom

      • isLimitedBottom

        private boolean isLimitedBottom
        These variables are updated to hold whether the Character is limited in moving to the Left, Right, Top or Bottom

      • projectiles

        private java.util.ArrayList<Projectile> projectiles
        This is an ArrayList of all the projectiles that are in the air made by the character.

      • objectHandler

        private ObjectHandler objectHandler

    • Constructor Detail

      • Character

        public Character(ObjectHandler objectHandler)
        This defines the Character.
        Parameters:
        objectHandler - this is the game's objectHandler

    • Method Detail

      • update

        public void update(boolean wPressed,
          boolean aPressed,
          boolean dPressed)
        This updates the screen width and height variables with ones passed // when the update function is called
        Parameters:
        wPressed - This represents the state of the W key. True is pressed, false is released
        aPressed - This represents the state of the A key. True is pressed, false is released
        dPressed - This represents the state of the D key. True is pressed, false is released

      • setBoundaries

        private void setBoundaries()

      • checkBoundaries

        private void checkBoundaries()
        This checks if the Character is collided with the Boundaries that are set by setBoundaries. This function sets isLimitedLeft, isLimitedRight, isLimitedTop, and isLimitedBottom

      • enforceBoundaries

        private void enforceBoundaries()
        This enforces the Boundaries, using variables set by setBoundaries and checkBoundaries. This function uses the info provided by those functions and sets the speedX, speedY, centerX, and centerY.

      • shoot

        public void shoot(int xRate,
         int yRate)
        This function tells the Character to shoot at the next opportunity
        Parameters:
        xRate - this is the x Speed that the projectile will move. This is multiplied by the Character's ProjectileSpeed when the Projectile is created, so only use 1, 0, or -1 if you are not trying to make super slow or super fast projectiles

      • getCenterX

        public int getCenterX()
        This gets the x Position of this Characters Center.
        Returns:
        the x position of the center of this character.Note that this is the center, not the upper left hand corner

      • getCenterY

        public int getCenterY()
        This gets the y Position of this Characters Center.
        Returns:
        the y position of the center of this character. Note that this is the center, not the upper left hand corner

      • getProjectiles

        public java.util.ArrayList<Projectile> getProjectiles()
        This function returns an ArrayList of Projectiles
        Returns:
        an ArrayList of the Projectiles in the Air

      • rotation

        public double rotation()
        This returns the Characters current rotation
        Returns:
        This characters current rotation

        Returns:
